intro: Macaglia pachyptera, commonly known as the thick-leaved macaglia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in dry, rocky environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
